title: Understanding Isotopes
text: Isotopes are atoms of the same element with different numbers of neutrons, resulting in different atomic masses. In this problem, you are dealing with two isotopes of Lumina.

title: Average Atomic Mass Formula
text: The average atomic mass of an element is calculated using the formula: $$mass1 abundance1+mass2 abundance2$$. This formula will help you find the unknown mass of the second isotope.

title: Setting Up the Equation
text: You know the average atomic mass $$(122.107$$ au) and the mass and abundance of the first isotope $$(120.904$$ au and $$62.50\%)$$. Set up the equation: $$122.107=120.904\times0.625+mass2 abundance2$$.

title: Finding the Abundance of the Second Isotope
text: Since the total abundance must equal 100%, the abundance of the second isotope is $$100\%-62.50\%=37.50\%$$ or $$0.375$$ in decimal form.

title: Solving for the Unknown Mass
text: Substitute the known values into the equation: $$122.107=120.904\times0.625+0.375mass2$$. Solve for mass2 by isolating it on one side of the equation.
